Posts.Content: Jan 25, 2009 11:56AM daybyday1 wrote: As some of you may recall, I'm scheduled for left modified radical mastectomy 1/27 and just wanted to know if any of you experienced moderate to severe pain in your breast, shoulder and neck (sometimes center of chest-between both breasts) that went away once you had the surgery.  With all the se's I've been going through with Herceptin - sore muscles, achey legs, headaches etc.  I just want the pain to be over with. This is a recurrence for me. I was diagnosed May 2007 and had Lumpectomy 7/5/07 (IDC 3cm Gr3 Stage IIb/III 1/3 nodes er/pr - her2+).  I had AC x4 every 21 days, then Taxol x4 every 21 days, then Herceptin every 21 days for 1yr. I completed my year of Herceptin 11/08.  I felt a lump under my left arm a couple of weeks prior to my LAST Herceptin treatment and ct of chest, biopsy and pet scan confirmed metastatic left axillary lymph nodes and recurrent left breast cancer. No evidence of distant sites thankfully.  Wishing all a speedy recovery!
